description:
We currently have a contract opportunity for a Data Scientist to lend specific subject matter knowledge around modeling and qualitative analysis.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Lead the development of data-driven strategies for optimizing vendor management and assortment planning.
• The role involves building, validating, and deploying machine learning models to generate insights for assortment optimization, vendor performance, demand forecasting, basket analysis, customer decision tree, ABC analysis, customer segmentation, and price elasticity analysis with a responsibility for maintaining and improving these models over time based on changing business needs and environment.
• The role entails analyzing and interpreting complex datasets related to vendors and assortment, translating this data into actionable insights, and providing valuable recommendations to management.
• Ensure adherence to data governance policies and maintain high standards of data integrity.
• The role involves cross-functional collaboration with merchandising, supply chain, and sales teams to provide data-driven insights, spearheading data science projects to ensure they meet business objectives, developing clear presentations to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders, mentoring junior data scientists and analysts, and staying current with latest trends in data science, machine learning, and the retail industry.

Skills

data scientist

python

Qualifications
• Master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related discipline or a bachelor’s degree in any related field
• Minimum of 4-5 years of experience is required but 8 years + is preferred as a senior or lead data scientist, preferably in the retail industry.
• Good understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
• Expertise in predictive modeling and statistics, including deep understanding of machine learning algorithms.
• Proficient in programming languages like Python, R, and toolsets like SQL.
• Strong understanding of retail KPIs and previous experience in ABC analysis, clustering, basket analysis, demand forecasting, price elasticity modeling, and linear programming.
• Excellent leadership, communication, and project management skills.

The expected pay rate range for this contract assignment is $90 to $120 per hour. Exact pay rate will vary based on skills, experience, and location.
